alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Randolph (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:49AM CDT until March 27 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Spring River At Imboden affecting Lawrence and Randolph Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River At Imboden. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Water approaching structures and populated areas of Eastern Imboden. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 25.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Spring River Imboden 18.0 7.1 Fri 9 AM 25.0 15.3 10.1 25.0 1 PM 3/25 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
